discussion.content:
In PRINCE2, a project must have at least two management stages:
● an initiation stage
● at least one further management stage. The more complex and risky a project is, the more management
stages will be required.

questions.question_text: Which statement about stages is true?

choices.B: The use of technical stages is mandatory
choices.A: Management stages should be of the same duration
choices.C: The use of management stages is mandatory
choices.D: Management stages are driven by specialist teams

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The Work Package specifies what work needs to be done, how it will be completed, and how progress and quality will be reported back to the Project Manager. This includes reporting requirements such as frequency, format, and methods.

Selected Answer: D
Glossary: The work package will contain a description of the work,
the product description(s), details of any constraints on production, and confirmation of the agreement between the project manager and the person or team manager who is to implement the work package that the work can be done within the constraints.

questions.question_text: What product defines the reporting requirements between the Project Manager and Team Manager?

discussion.content: A is correct but it is not within the checkpoint report the Project Manager captures an informal issue in the highlight report that is given to the Project Board which is noted in the lessons log.

A is correct
A.14.3 Derivation
The lessons log is derived from the following:
● lessons from other projects
● project mandate or project brief
● daily log, issue register, quality register and risk register
● checkpoint reports and highlight reports
● completed work packages
● stage plans with actuals
● observation and experience of the project’s processes.

questions.question_text: Which is a purpose of a Lessons Log?
Which is a true statement about PRINCE2 event-driven controls?

choices.C: Event-driven controls are used for decision making
choices.A: Event-driven controls take place at predefined periodic intervals
choices.B: Event-driven controls are produced at the frequency defined in a Work Package

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Checkpoint Reports:
These reports are produced at predetermined points in the project, usually at the end of a stage or when a significant milestone is reached, making them an example of an event-driven control.

Selected Answer: C
-Types of controls 

• Event-driven 
Takes place when a specific event occurs: 
 - End of a stage 
 - Completion of the Project Initiation Documentation (PID) 

• Time-driven
Takes place at pre-defined periodic intervals: 
 - Highlight Reports 
 - Checkpoint Reports
